general.headline: CTO / EVP Research & Development
general.mutualConnectionsText: Hamilton Mann, Ben Costantini, and 311 other mutual connections
general.description:
Leveraging my broad academic and industrial international experience, I love to bring Innovation and Impact through science and technology, from lab to plant and market. I partner with business leaders to foster an innovation open to the outside (customers, suppliers, start-ups, academia ..) where customer obsession and strategic partnerships are key pillars.
I stimulate the worldwide R&D organization with a strong emphasis on collaboration, openness, diversity, and talent development to deliver a sustained performance.

I am a strong believer that the environmental situation that we collectively face results in both fantastic challenges and exciting opportunities for R&D, requiring us to foster and combine the energies from all worlds (academia, start-ups and SMEs, large corporations, investors, governments) across traditional value chains and market silos. My personal experience convinced me that partnerships are a key vector to Transform and Innovate at the proper pace.

On a personal side I am energized by great science, business strategy, working in multicultural and international environments, building value partnerships by proper consideration of each parties interest, teamworking with bright people, and coaching people in their own work and development.

Key words: Innovation | multicultural | physics | chemistry | biotechnology | materials science | microfluidics | products and process tehnologies | sustainability | impact | hydroge n| fuel cells | energy efficiency | energy storage | construction products | building science | customer focus | value creation 
 | automobile | mobility | life sciences | green energy | partnerships | joint ventures | JDA | start-ups | academia | industry | investment funds | GreenTech | DeepTech | societal impact | collaboration | talent development | senior advisor | board member.

general.headline: CTO
general.mutualConnectionsText: Yann Lechelle, Yann Sarfati, and 137 other mutual connections
general.description:
I’m passionate with technologies: for what they are and moreover for what they enable.

I’ve built my professional carrier on that basis: to study and analyze new technologies and engage them into tools, platforms, R&D prototypes, all of them meeting the company business activity and strategy.

Thus, my role and responsibility eventually advanced to building and managing technical teams, constituted of developers, project managers, QA testers, system and database administrators and product owners.

As a CTO, I'm also part of the senior executive team actively participating to defining the business strategy and aligning the technical strategy accordingly.

Thanks to my professional experiences, I'm fully qualified to actively participate to defining and applying a company's strategy. By recruiting the right talents, motivating them with proper objectives and relevant work processes, I contribute to the company's success having efficient teams, providing highly reliable platforms and developing a strong sense of communication and cross teams collaboration.

jobs.description:
Managing an agile team - scrum-based - of 60 people: product & roadmap, development, infrastructure and quality assurance teams
Participating as a full-time member to the executive team (6 members)
Managing performance and availability responsibility for PriceMinister WEB & Mobile marketplace - hundred of millions of page views a month
Collaborating with international technical teams of Rakuten Group
Leading the R&D effort

Technology team manager for Phonevalley, the mobile advertisement company of Publicis Group

Phonevalley accompanies Publicis’ clients in defining their communication (advertisement) strategy through mobile channels (messaging, sites, webapps and applications). Publics Group acquired the company in 2007: we centralize the mobile skills for the group, especially for the European and US markets.
As the CTO of Phonevalley, I manage the technological skillset of the company’s technical department. Competencies are organized into 3 distinct units: platforms (development, maintenance and running proprietary platforms), services (clients’ mobile projects production) and support (technological partnerships management and system administration).

Technology Director:
•	Define the technological strategy of the company (production organization, proprietary platforms, R&D orientations)
•	Team management (reports, tasks tracking, organization / staffing, procedures): around 15 technical project managers and 20 offshore developers
•	Production capacity management (partners and providers)
•	Technical answers to RFI, RFQ, RFP
•	Key clients / accounts management: pre-sale, sizing / hiring / training / management of dedicated teams, organization, technical referrer, etc.

Platform and R&D Director:
•	Conception of proprietary platforms to support the company global strategy
•	Technology orientation: needs definition, environment / software / architecture selection
•	Technology watch
•	Participate to platforms development, debug and maintenance phases
•	R&D: analysis, reports, financial helps
See above

Management of Phonevalley technical team in charge of handling all mobile Internet projects (WAP-based technologies, iMode, etc.)

Two different roles:
 1/ Team manager: hire, train and manage the technical team (up to 7 project managers and developers)
 2/ Strategy development: identify technical requirements to cope with agency's and clients' expectations; oversee proprietary platforms development (rendering engine and mobile Internet site development tool)

Management of the technical team responsible for developing a geo-localized MMORPG

NewtGames was born with the second Japanese mobile operator (KDDI) new massive offer of GPS-enabled cell phones. The business model of this French startup was to leverage this geo-localization capability to bring Massively-Multi Users Role Playing Game to the streets and allow users to play the game while moving their avatars in the real world.

My role was to manage the technical team (developers, graphic artists, WEB developers) in order to build a game engine flexible enough to implement several kind of geo-localized MMORPG (different game designs, different game backgrounds, etc.) I have realized the server-side software architecture, written technical specifications and participated to the development (especially to the development of a Geographic Information System for the specific purpose of the game). More precisely:
    •	I hired and managed the technical team (up to 6 people)
    •	I wrote the technical specifications (software architecture, environment, etc.) of the MMORPG game engine
    •	I wrote the technical specifications (software architecture, environment, etc.) of a GIS (Geographic Information System), based on several algorithms: Dijkstra, Cohen-Sutherland  – this GIS has been used for a Nike and SFR (French operator) advertisement program against racism
    •	I’ve initiated and participated to R&D effort
I have also lead the effort of submitting a request for financial help from the French government to support innovative companies. The name of the program is ANVAR and NewtGames has been approved to participate to this program to achieve its innovative developments.

A game (named Mogii) has been successfully deployed in Japan in April 2003. It was live until end of 2006.

Analysis, architecture and development of an interactive system including a Video-On-Demand platform

My main role in this company was to build an interactive platform which purpose was to be deployed aboard cruise ships.
I have analyzed the needs, provided relevant software architecture for the platform (using CORBA distributed architecture, SNMP for network fault management and a 3rd party Video-On-Demand platform called NCube) and participated to the platform development and deployment.
The platform has been successfully deployed into 60 crew member cabins for a first live test when I still was working for the company.
I have also participated to several IT system administration tasks, including managing file servers, application servers and accounting platform.
I have left the company at the end of the internship, called Coopération au Service Militaire en Entreprise, which is an opportunity for French master’s degree graduates to work for a subsidiary of a French enterprise in a foreign country in place of the compulsory military duty.

general.headline: CEO & CTO at DXOMARK
general.mutualConnectionsText: Alexandre GRUX, Barbara Koper, and 58 other mutual connections
general.description: I am currently the CEO & CTO of DXOMARK, a French engineering services scale-up whose former parent company DxO Labs I cofounded in 2003. Mathematician by qualification, passionate about image Quality and Photography, I have dedicated most of my professional life to the use of applied sciences in the improvement of consumer experience of electronics. To that effect in the last 2 decades I have overseen the technical development of consumer experience oriented measurement tools (Analyzer) and test protocols in imaging, image processing tools and SW for photographers, ISP chains and cameras.  I hold 30+ patent families and 50+ scientific publications in the world of imaging.

jobs.description: My aim as the CEO & CTO is to extend the consumer oriented approach of consumer electronics testing that has been a part of DXOMARK since the DxO Labs days to various product categories and other multimedia specialties such as audio and display. My vision is to build a company that values collaboration, innovation and strives for excellence.

Heading technical development of imaging products at DxO Labs, I oversaw the design and creation of 
-	Optics Pro & PhotoLab that are raw convertors for advanced photographers
-	Image Quality Labs, tools and methodologies
-	Dxomark.com a free online database of cameras, lenses and smartphones
-	SW and silicon ISP IPs
-	Lens/camera modules and ISP codesigns that have been integrated in hundred millions of camera sold in the world

Developed surveillance and computer vision products. The Poseidon System that detects drowning accidents in large public swimming pools is perhaps the first device that used computer vision to save lives!
Creation of LIVIC, now IFSTTAR, for development of ADAS (Advanced driver assistance systems) applications in autonomous driving.
Provided image tools, SW and analysis for forensics. Worked several high profile cases including forensic imaging for the O. J. Simpson case.

jobs.jobTitle: Technical Coaching, Audit, Interim CTO, Digital IT Expert
jobs.description:
Make the right choices for the right reasons!

A gap is widening between the business and IT departments. In almost 20 years, I have seen companies of all sizes, facing all types of projects. And yet, my first observation is often the same: I realize that everyone does their job pretty well.

Business, technological and managerial issues must be reconciled
- Audit: understand, discover and analyze the context -> return to the use of the project
- Advice: drive improvement, priorities, governance, tools, organization -> the heart of the matter
- Coaching: develop, raise awareness, enrich skills -> perpetuate this organization

Information technology expert for almost 20 years

I led technical web and new media teams for high traffic content or news sites. I advised medium and large companies in their digital and transformation strategy. I was an entrepreneur at the heart of the startup ecosystem

Your partner on your digital transformation, web and digital projects
Expert on IT Management and Governance for small to large companies

Providing strong advices and expertise about technological impact on the business : product vs technology, tech roadmap, service providers selection, performance issues, load and organization of production, ...

Wellcut was an innovative online video sharing solution: cut and share your preferred video moment on the fly - your micro-video clip is ready to share with your friends, fans and followers.

You are a video publisher ? 
- Get your videos social and "easy to snack", 
- Amplify your social and mobile visibility, 
- Engage your audience, 
Tease your premium video content via micro-video clips 
and drive traffic towards your full-length videos. 
Wellcut is a turnkey solution that integrates via API on partners publishers video players. 

Wellcut is the easiest way to share and promote short pieces of online video, at the push of a button, both for you, publishers, and for your users. 

Wellcut does not exist anymore. We didn't find our market, and I had to terminate the activity after 5 great years and 1.5M€ raised.

publications.title: [PODCAST] Episode #1 : Produit et Tech, collaboration ou compétition ?
publications.description:
Dans cet épisode, nous recevons deux invités exceptionnels :
Céline Bayer, CTO chez Veesion
Nicolas Silberman, Group CTO-CPO chez Unify Group

Le débat du jour porte sur les relations entre Produit et Tech.

Sommes-nous dans une approche de collaboration ou de compétition ?

Des éléments de réponse dans l'épisode #1 !

publications.title: [CONFERENCE] Unifier tout en préservant l’ADN de chaque marque
publications.description:
Du #projet au #produit : organisation, méthodologie, vision, topologie des équipes, transformation et gestion du changement. Voilà les mots-clés qui m'animent depuis bientôt 2 ans chez UNIFY GROUP et plus particulièrement autours des marques Marmiton, Doctissimo et AuFeminin

Unify rassemble les activités digitales du Groupe TF1 (hors sites des chaînes) pour créer un écosystème puissant au cœur du quotidien des français·es avec des marques fortes comme Marmiton, Doctissimo, LesNumériques, Gamekult ou Aufeminin.

Ce retour d’expérience montre comment le groupe Unify s’est transformé en adoptant une organisation orientée Produit mais également en travaillant sur une harmonisation de l’ensemble des plateformes, process et méthodes des équipes produits et développement. De la mutualisation des méthodes au sein des équipes jusqu’au enjeux de communication à l’ensemble des parties prenantes et de la direction, le challenge est important, la vision produit essentielle et l’agilité indispensable

publications.title: [PODCAST] Unify : faire face aux enjeux des marques digitales de TF1
publications.description:
Après avoir travaillé pour Mediapart, CondéNast ou encore 20Minutes, Nicolas Silberman est désormais le CTO et le CPO de Unify Group, entité digitale du groupe TF1 et co-fondateur du podcast Tech Rocks. 

Dans cet épisode, on évoque : 

# La tech, qui occupe une place centrale dans la vie d’une entreprise, et qui peut la challenger en apportant des réponses et des innovations. 

# La nécessité de bien travailler son SEO, intégré à la stratégie de la société, pour tous les contenus digitaux.  

# La tendance “bien-être” qui inonde les contenus et influence les différentes fonctionnalités sur Internet et les réseaux sociaux.  

# L’importance de communiquer les études de Médiamétrie, en externe comme en interne, pour orienter au mieux son positionnement et optimiser la collaboration avec des partenaires.  

# Les enjeux, comme l’uniformisation, soulevés par la stratégie de Unify, fondée uniquement sur des acquisitions. 

# La répartition inégale des audiences entre site web et application. 

# Le marché du web, très challengé au niveau du référencement, car il est régi par les règles et les algorithmes de Google. 

# Les différences SEO entre le contenu froid et le contenu chaud. 

# La commercialisation auprès des annonceurs de données ciblées et pertinentes. 

# Les dernières évolutions tech – des outils sont apparus pour faciliter l’expérience utilisateur et des métiers se sont développés : les développeurs front jouent un rôle de plus en plus important. 

# Le choix des annonceurs, qui se fait en fonction de leur impact carbone – l’écologie étant plus que jamais un enjeu essentiel du digital.

jobs.companyName: Max Planck Institute for Plasma Physics
jobs.description:
Postdoctoral position in the group "Turbulence in Laboratory and Astrophysical Plasmas"
• Statistical analysis of nonlocal turbulent transport, comparison of reduced models
• Turbulence simulations including realistic geometry and measured experimental profiles
• Principal Investigator for a project on the IFERC-CSC supercomputer (5M CPU hours, 2013-4)

Member of the GYSELA team, development and application of a gyrokinetic code
• Analytical study of the conservation properties of the gyrokinetic model
• Development of numerical methods for solving the Vlasov-Poisson system
• Optimization of numerical algorithms for High-Performance-Computing (HPC) simulations
• Implementation of new diagnostics to compare numerical results with experimental observations
• Physical interpretation of numerical simulations, in particular statistical analysis of turbulence
• Participation in the European fusion work program 2010-11: reply to call for proposals, advancement meetings, writing of intermediate and final reports

Internship on optimal fuel reloading of nuclear reactors
• Adaptation of existing codes for in-core fuel management to the new "EPR" reactor
• Comparison of several optimization methods (simulated annealing, genetic algorithms, ...) in view
of developing a new code at EDF.
